screen_desc: The screenshot shows a mobile browser with multiple tabs open, displaying shopping cart pages from different websites. The top tab is from Target and shows an item added to the cart. Below it, there is a Best Buy tab with a prompt for returning customers to sign in and a "Return to cart" button. The third tab is from Newegg, displaying information about a Razer BlackShark V2 Pro wireless gaming headset. The bottom tab shows a similar Razer Kraken X USB Ultralight gaming headset from Newegg, with a heart icon indicating the option to add to favorites.
action_think: To clear the items from the cart on walmart.com, I need to open a browser tab dedicated to Walmart. After that, I can proceed to add items to the cart. Since the current browser has multiple tabs open, I should first close all the existing tabs except for the one I want to focus on.
action_plan: Close all existing tabs except for the one with the Walmart tab
Open a new tab if necessary
action_desc: close the tab with the Razer BlackShark V2 Pro wireless gaming headset
action_result: The last action was to scroll down, which caused the top left tab to become visible. This action has brought up the cart page on walmart.com, making progress towards the user request.
